details.text:
I am Zak Avila.

I have been writing code for most of my life. I was first exposed to programming in elementary school by a program called ZZT. I developed games for it with its basic programming language. During middle school, I started to teach myself C++ using whatever resources I could get my hands on.

After getting my first smartphone in college and learning how to develop apps, I was addicted. Apps immediately provide you with the information or services you are looking for, just by tapping an icon.

When I am not developing something, I am probably: running, crowdsurfing at a concert, or pondering consiousness in the shower.

choices.title: phraze
choices.subtitle: March 2015 - Present
choices.text:
▪ iOS game that gives random words, a timer, and the challenge of getting the people you are with to guess the word
▪ Added to the app store on 4/1/2015

Click here for screenshots and here to download

choices.title: Artists of Separation
choices.subtitle: December 2014 - January 2015
choices.text:
▪ iOS app that determines the smallest number of steps to get from one artist to another through Related Artists on Spotify
▪ Uses BFS and makes 20 queries/second to get to the target artist

Click here for screenshots

choices.title: spotter
choices.subtitle: April 2014 - Present
choices.text:
▪ iOS app that creatively displays your distance from another person by showing if you are getting 'hotter' or 'colder'
▪ Uses BLE without pairing or connecting
▪ Added to the app store on 7/22/2014 and updated for iOS8

Click here for screenshots and here to download

choices.title: genre map
choices.subtitle: February 2014 - May 2014
choices.text:
▪ Interactive visualization using D3.js and the Echonest API to compare music genre interests between friends
▪ Java backend on Google App Engine for computations
▪ Optimized for scalability with the Echonest API limits
▪ Uses custom algorithm to determine friends with similar interests

Click here for screenshots and here to try it out

choices.title: awhile
choices.subtitle: March 2014 - May 2014
choices.text:
▪ iOS app that converts between your age and different increments of time
▪ Created a unique half-circle spinner that can infinitely loop or increase its contents

Click here for screenshots and here to see more

choices.title: SuperRdio
choices.subtitle: January 2014 - February 2014
choices.text:
▪ Alternative iOS interface for Rdio app with additional features added
▪ Uses Rdio and LastFM APIs to achieve a more user friendly interface

choices.title: ContextLock
choices.subtitle: December 2013
choices.text: ▪ Android app that determines where the user frequently spends time so it can lock the phone in foreign places

choices.title: HourTracker
choices.subtitle: Fall 2013
choices.text:
▪ iOS app to log work hours, designed for iOS7
▪ Contextually learns where the user works so it can give reminders to record the time upon arriving/leaving work

choices.title: LiveForum
choices.subtitle: Summer 2013
choices.text:
▪ Android app for creating and posting in location-based message boards
▪ Parse used as a backend

details.text:
phraze gives you a random word, a timer, and the challenge of getting the people you are with to guess the word. You can get them to guess the word through explanation, acting, drawing, or all of the above. The rules are up to you!

phraze can be downloaded for iOS here

spotter helps you find your locate your nearby friends by showing if you are getting 'hotter' or 'colder'. It uses bluetooth to do this, but without pairing.

spotter is available on iOS here

genre map is a web application that uses your facebook artists to create an interactive diagram showing what genres of music you like. It also does this for each of your friends as well and uses a custom algorithm to determine which friends are most similar.

genremap can be found here

The brainchild of Sebastian Frith, awhile is an iOS app that shows what your current age will be at different time increments.

See more about awhile here
An iOS app that provides an alternative interface for Rdio with a drawer for easily creating playlists on the go. Uses the Rdio api and LastFM api.
HourTracker contextually determines when you are at work and helps keeps track of your hours spent in the office.
